verses.text_plain: And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.
verses.verse_html:
1And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth. ▼
▼ the steward…: Heb. him that was over his house

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the steward…: Heb. him that was over his house
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the steward…: Heb. him that was over his house

verses.text_plain: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
verses.verse_html: 2And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.

verses.text_plain: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
verses.verse_html: 3As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.

verses.text_plain: And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
verses.verse_html: 4And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?

tokens.text: unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded

verses.text_plain: Is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
verses.verse_html:
5Is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing. ▼
▼ divineth: or, maketh trial?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ divineth: or, maketh trial?

verses.text_plain: And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
verses.verse_html: 6And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.

verses.text_plain: And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:
verses.verse_html: 7And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:

verses.text_plain: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?
verses.verse_html: 8Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?

tokens.text: unto thee out of the land

verses.text_plain: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.
verses.verse_html: 9With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.

tokens.text: and we also will be my lord’s

verses.text_plain: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.
verses.verse_html: 10And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.

tokens.text: he with whom it is found

verses.text_plain: Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
verses.verse_html: 11Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.

verses.text_plain: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
verses.verse_html: 12And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.

verses.text_plain: Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
verses.verse_html: 13Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.

verses.text_plain: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house; for he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
verses.verse_html: 14And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house; for he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine?
verses.verse_html:
15And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine? ▼
▼ divine: or, make trial?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ divine: or, make trial?

verses.text_plain: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord’s servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.
verses.verse_html: 16And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord’s servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

tokens.text: or how shall we clear ourselves

verses.text_plain: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.
verses.verse_html: 17And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.

tokens.text: and as for you, get you up

verses.text_plain: Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.
verses.verse_html: 18Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.

verses.text_plain: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
verses.verse_html: 19My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?

verses.text_plain: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
verses.verse_html: 20And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.

verses.text_plain: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
verses.verse_html: 21And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.

tokens.text: unto me, that I may set

verses.text_plain: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
verses.verse_html: 22And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.

verses.text_plain: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
verses.verse_html: 23And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
verses.verse_html: 24And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.

tokens.text: And it came to pass when we came up

verses.text_plain: And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.
verses.verse_html: 25And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.

verses.text_plain: And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face, except our youngest brother be with us.
verses.verse_html: 26And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face, except our youngest brother be with us.

tokens.text: with us, then will we go down

verses.text_plain: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
verses.verse_html: 27And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:

verses.text_plain: And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since:
verses.verse_html: 28And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since:

verses.text_plain: And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
verses.verse_html: 29And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad’s life;
verses.verse_html: 30Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad’s life;

tokens.text: not with us; seeing that his life

verses.text_plain: It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
verses.verse_html: 31It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.

tokens.text: It shall come to pass, when he seeth

verses.text_plain: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.
verses.verse_html: 32For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.

tokens.text: him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
verses.verse_html: 33Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.

tokens.text: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant

verses.text_plain: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.
verses.verse_html:
34For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father. ▼
▼ come…: Heb. find my father

tokens.text: not with me? lest peradventure I see

footnotes.body_html: ▼ come…: Heb. find my father
